767e84db20d1e794e7574789b5c7c23c (02:05): so we let them

5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:05): Well, yah, it's difficult to tell a manager that if he'd been doing his job, he wouldn't be in your cube asking for all these technical fixes to a basic human issue
767e84db20d1e794e7574789b5c7c23c (02:05): this one guy had been abusing it and had been talked to about it
767e84db20d1e794e7574789b5c7c23c (02:05): you know, going 5 minutes over etc
767e84db20d1e794e7574789b5c7c23c (02:05): one day he ended up taking a 1/2 hr break

767e84db20d1e794e7574789b5c7c23c (02:06): the secretary let the president know and he went out there and was like

6735c9ab9b1ac69d7d2f449177128eca (02:06): I'm not paying MS prices for help using their product
767e84db20d1e794e7574789b5c7c23c (02:06): frb, what do you need to do ?
f72d339005f2adc01268d9c01bafae23 (02:07): I think in order to have world peace we need to send all Microsoft users to the sun. seems that they are violent and have one sidded views.
6735c9ab9b1ac69d7d2f449177128eca (02:07): I have a list of citys and states in a spreadsheet, and I'd like to get a count of how many items are in each city,state
6735c9ab9b1ac69d7d2f449177128eca (02:07): Randal1: please leave
d50e4c9abc8596e9cefa6f40082c8bee (02:07): constructive criticism homie.
767e84db20d1e794e7574789b5c7c23c (02:07): hmm...let me do it I'll brb after hacking Randal1 's box

5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:08): ninjabunny: that story is funny, but it shows the exact attitude I've been talking about. Your mgmt and workers are just escalating a war of hacking and rationalization against one another.
767e84db20d1e794e7574789b5c7c23c (02:08): ya its not them tho...its the shitbags we have to deal with in this area

de5057fbbac6623965fe11701309c7fb (02:09): quux, who's address is that?
767e84db20d1e794e7574789b5c7c23c (02:09): frb, try to find a count function
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:09): That *was* Randal1
6735c9ab9b1ac69d7d2f449177128eca (02:09): it's Randal1, he can't speak now
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:10): I tried working with him in privmsg
d50e4c9abc8596e9cefa6f40082c8bee (02:10): i saw +b not -q.
5c25b7bfc49ce3ff8821c0ec86afa4b7 (02:10): the % basically makes it a +q
6735c9ab9b1ac69d7d2f449177128eca (02:10): on freenode, a ban implies no voice
d50e4c9abc8596e9cefa6f40082c8bee (02:10): ahh.
767e84db20d1e794e7574789b5c7c23c (02:11): frb, that's cake for excel
767e84db20d1e794e7574789b5c7c23c (02:12): =COUNT(<Value1>:<Value2>)
6735c9ab9b1ac69d7d2f449177128eca (02:12): ninjabunny: the issue is that I have a list of 160 items, and I want to count each one's city,state automatically
767e84db20d1e794e7574789b5c7c23c (02:12): give it a range and it will count the number of occupied cells
767e84db20d1e794e7574789b5c7c23c (02:12): frb, I'd export the sheet into Access
767e84db20d1e794e7574789b5c7c23c (02:12): and save the trouble
6c75a58bee09225cd04625c6993796b5 (02:13): there's an easier way
767e84db20d1e794e7574789b5c7c23c (02:13): or link it to a vb datasource and check for uniques
6735c9ab9b1ac69d7d2f449177128eca (02:13): I'm not that leet
6735c9ab9b1ac69d7d2f449177128eca (02:13): hell, I'm using Office2k7 because it's pretty :/
767e84db20d1e794e7574789b5c7c23c (02:14): frb, its tough to explain but a little reading and you'd be able to do it
6c75a58bee09225cd04625c6993796b5 (02:16): hold on I'll help you
767e84db20d1e794e7574789b5c7c23c (02:16): there we go perhaps a little time-out will do the trick
6c75a58bee09225cd04625c6993796b5 (02:17): frb: How is it organized
6c75a58bee09225cd04625c6993796b5 (02:17): City/State/etc are different columns?
6735c9ab9b1ac69d7d2f449177128eca (02:18): <branchname> <street addr> <city> <state> <zip>
767e84db20d1e794e7574789b5c7c23c (02:18): frb, sounds like that should be in a database anyway (just a suggestion)
fb41303bb8eeff0ec274b6b4f6669762 (02:18): writing technical docs in word 2007 is a dream
6735c9ab9b1ac69d7d2f449177128eca (02:18): well, the information in the db combines street, city and state
6c75a58bee09225cd04625c6993796b5 (02:18): The funny thing is that I keep everything in MySQL then dump it to Excel via ODBC for statistic findings
6c75a58bee09225cd04625c6993796b5 (02:18): So I know a bunch about this stuff :)
6735c9ab9b1ac69d7d2f449177128eca (02:19): I'm not sure if a I can really do it that way anyway
6c75a58bee09225cd04625c6993796b5 (02:19): =COUNTIF(Table1[Username],"Statename")
6735c9ab9b1ac69d7d2f449177128eca (02:19): I would need to go get the zipcodedb, and start calulating distances too
6c75a58bee09225cd04625c6993796b5 (02:19): =COUNTIF(Table1[State],"Alabama")
6735c9ab9b1ac69d7d2f449177128eca (02:19): ie, Bronx, NY should be grouped with NYC
6c75a58bee09225cd04625c6993796b5 (02:19): gives you the total amount of people in Alabama ;)
6c75a58bee09225cd04625c6993796b5 (02:20): Well then you could have
6c75a58bee09225cd04625c6993796b5 (02:20): =COUNTIF(Table1[State],"NYC")+COUNTIF(Table1[Username],"Bronx")
6c75a58bee09225cd04625c6993796b5 (02:20): sorry I keep forgetting to change the table info there
6c75a58bee09225cd04625c6993796b5 (02:20): so assume those two are [State]
6735c9ab9b1ac69d7d2f449177128eca (02:20): but Bedford Hills, NY shouldn't be linked
6735c9ab9b1ac69d7d2f449177128eca (02:21): so by the time I write all the COUNTIF's I could have counted and been done with it
767e84db20d1e794e7574789b5c7c23c (02:21): frb, with the right amount of effort you can handle all of that in a database
6c75a58bee09225cd04625c6993796b5 (02:21): Some things are better in a real DB :)
6c75a58bee09225cd04625c6993796b5 (02:21): Excel is great for making pretty looking stats, that's about it
6c75a58bee09225cd04625c6993796b5 (02:21): oh, and invoices.
767e84db20d1e794e7574789b5c7c23c (02:22): that's why most db's export :)
